page.title: 03Eversley Folk-dance Club
page.content: The Folk-dance Club was founded in 1929 by a group of people including the lady we talked to, Mrs. Yeomans. She told us that there were fifteen members then but now there are about forty. Before they acquired their gramophone they danced to a comb and tissue-paper band. The entry fee was 6d but now everyone brings 25p. The club meets every second Tuesday in the village hall and their caller is also secretary. The club performs twice a year, once in the summer and once at Christmas. The members' ages range from twenty-one to over forty. The club often meets with other clubs in the area for a pleasant social evening.
